news_header: A judge has temporarily blocked President Trump from placing 2,200 USAID workers on paid leave, while another judge blocked Elon Musk's initiative from accessing Treasury records.
news_original_title: Judge blocks Trump plan to put thousands of USAID staff on leave
news_text: Judge Carl Nichols issued a temporary restraining order preventing President Trump from placing 2,200 workers at USAID on paid leave, following a lawsuit from two unions. The order will last until February 14. Separately, another judge blocked Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency from accessing Treasury records containing personal financial data of Americans. Trump aims to dismantle USAID, arguing it misuses taxpayer money, while unions claim the actions violate the Constitution and harm workers. The ruling reinstates previously placed staff on leave and prohibits further administrative leave until the specified date.
